intro: Nasa humboldtiana subsp. tricolor, commonly known as the three-color nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking tri-color flowers, which typically display shades of purple, blue, and white. The plant belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique coloration makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
